section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Drama, Fantasy, Comedy

div.div: Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu: Dai-4 Shou - Seiiki to Gouyoku no Majo
Action, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Fantasy, Romance

The 4th arc of the Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu manga.
On to the next stage: the witch’s tomb known as the Sanctuary- Determined to release Rem from a mysterious slumber, Subaru and Emilia return to Roswaal’s manor in search of clues on how to reach the Sanctuary, the secret location to which Ram and Roswaal escaped. But the way there is fraught with the unexpected-especially for Subaru, who finds himself in the company of a curious figure. A new chapter begins, and with it, a new adventure…
(Source: Yen Press)

An android whose mission had been long completed finds a child abandoned in the ruins of a war-ravaged city. Amidst a dystopian world, a machine and human become mother and son. This is the serialized version of the popular "Mechanical Buddy Universe" X comics by "Knight’s & Magic" author, Takuji Kato. (Source: Manga UP!)
Shangri-La Frontier: Kusoge Hunter, Kami ge ni Idoman to su

Second year high school student Rakuro Hizutome is interested in one thing only: finding "shitty games" and beating the crap out of them. His gaming skills are second to none, and no game is too bad for him to enjoy. So when he's introduced to the new VR game Shangri-La Frontier, he does what he does best—min-maxes and skips the prologue to jump straight into the action. But can even an expert gamer like Rakuro discover all the secrets that Shangri-La Frontier hides...? (Source: Kodansha USA)

Shintaro Ojiro, 39 years old. Low education, low income - what you'd call a bottom-tier citizen. A man who has continually lost and been deprived, cut off from society, at the end of his loneliness and despair, decides to assassinate a politician...
(Source: Yanmaga, translated)
Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!

Kazuma Sato is a video game-loving shut-in-or at least he was, until a humiliating traffic accident brings his young life to an untimely end. But after his death, a beautiful girl claiming to be a goddess invites him to enter another world and gain some respectable perks in the process. But Kazuma's choice is going to have serious consequences for the goddess and the dead man alike... (Source: Yen Press)

As players of Monster Hunter and Dungeons & Dragons know, the slime is not exactly the king of the fantasy monsters. So when a 37-year-old Tokyo salaryman dies and wakes up in a world of dragons and magic, he's a little disappointed to find he's become a blind, boneless slime monster.
(Source: Kodansha USA)
Honzuki no Gekokujou: Shisho ni Naru Tame ni wa Shudan wo Erandeiraremasen Dai 3-bu - Ryouchi ni Hon wo Hirogeyou!

Manga adaptation of Part 3 of Honzuki no Gekokujou. To protect those she cares about from danger, Myne abandons the life she knows to become Rozemyne, the archduke’s mana-rich adopted daughter. But her passion for books hasn’t changed, nor does she hesitate to charge into another strange new world. In this biblio-fantasy by bookworms, for bookworms, the detailed setting continues to expand—and so too does the book-making industry! (Source: J-Novel Club)

Stowing himself away on a slave ship, Julian sets sail for the great continent with a hundred slaves, all yearning for freedom, until...?! Embark on a groundbreaking journey through this action-packed dark fantasy saga!! (Source: Manga Plus)

Follows the life of a hero who manages to win all battles with only one punch. This ability seems to frustrate him as he no longer feels the thrill and adrenaline of fighting a tough battle, which leads to him questioning his past desire of being strong.
The original drawn by ONE.
TSUYOSHI: Daremo Katenai, Aitsu ni wa

Tsuyoshi Kawabata is just a regular convenience store employee in a mid-sized city west of Tokyo. Except... he also happens to be the most powerful fighter in the world. Although he doesn't particularly want to fight, his reputation precedes him, and martial artists come from all over the world to test their might against the mythical Tsuyoshi – and invariably end up handily beaten, clutching their battered family jewels in a convenience store parking lot. Should you wish to fight him, he has three rules to minimize inconvenience: 1) You only get one fight. There will be no rematch. 2) You will fight in a secluded area, where you won't be seen. 3) You will tell nobody about it – even if you lose.
